payload.content: Claude Code has released a significant update to its agent system called "Agent Teams."

name: Claude Code has released a significant update to its agent system called "Agent
content: Claude Code has released a significant update to its agent system called "Agent Teams."

payload.content: Agent Teams represent a fundamentally different execution model from the old task + sub-agent model, allowing 3–5 independent Claude Code instances to collaborate, share context, exchange messages, and coordinate via a shared task system.

name: Agent Teams represent a fundamentally different execution model from the old tas
content: Agent Teams represent a fundamentally different execution model from the old task + sub-agent model, allowing 3–5 independent Claude Code instances to collaborate, share context, exchange messages, and coordinate via a shared task system.

payload.content: To enable Agent Teams, update Claude Code to the latest version, then add `"CLAUDE_CODE_EXPERIMENTAL_AGENT_TEAMS": "1"` to the `env` section of your `~/.claude/settings.json` file and restart your terminal.

name: To enable Agent Teams, update Claude Code to the latest version, then add `"CLAU
content: To enable Agent Teams, update Claude Code to the latest version, then add `"CLAUDE_CODE_EXPERIMENTAL_AGENT_TEAMS": "1"` to the `env` section of your `~/.claude/settings.json` file and restart your terminal.

payload.content: Agent Teams are activated by explicitly instructing Claude Code to create an agent team in your prompt, for example: "Create an agent team to explore this from different angles: one teammate on UX, one on technical architecture, one playing devil's advocate."

name: Agent Teams are activated by explicitly instructing Claude Code to create an age
content: Agent Teams are activated by explicitly instructing Claude Code to create an agent team in your prompt, for example: "Create an agent team to explore this from different angles: one teammate on UX, one on technical architecture, one playing devil's advocate."

payload.content: Agent Teams are most effective when all agents' work can be viewed in parallel, ideally using tools like tmux or iTerm2 on macOS.

name: Agent Teams are most effective when all agents' work can be viewed in parallel,
content: Agent Teams are most effective when all agents' work can be viewed in parallel, ideally using tools like tmux or iTerm2 on macOS.

payload.content: To set up iTerm2 for Agent Teams, install iTerm2, enable Python API in Settings → General → Magic, restart iTerm2, and then launch Claude Code with `claude --teammate-mode tmux` to open separate panes for the team lead and each agent teammate.

name: To set up iTerm2 for Agent Teams, install iTerm2, enable Python API in Settings
content: To set up iTerm2 for Agent Teams, install iTerm2, enable Python API in Settings → General → Magic, restart iTerm2, and then launch Claude Code with `claude --teammate-mode tmux` to open separate panes for the team lead and each agent teammate.

payload.content: The old Claude Code model involved a main agent calling a task tool, which spun up an isolated sub-agent that worked independently, terminated its session, and returned only a summary to the main agent.

name: The old Claude Code model involved a main agent calling a task tool, which spun
content: The old Claude Code model involved a main agent calling a task tool, which spun up an isolated sub-agent that worked independently, terminated its session, and returned only a summary to the main agent.

payload.content: Agent Teams introduce shared task lists, inter-agent messaging and communication, and explicit lifecycle control (startup, shutdown), enabled by new internal tools.

name: Agent Teams introduce shared task lists, inter-agent messaging and communication
content: Agent Teams introduce shared task lists, inter-agent messaging and communication, and explicit lifecycle control (startup, shutdown), enabled by new internal tools.

payload.content: The `TeamCreate` tool initiates an Agent Team by creating a new team folder under `.claude/teams/`, establishing the team's scaffolding before any agents are assigned. It requires a `team_name`, `description`, and `agent_type` (e.g., "researcher", "test-runner").

name: The `TeamCreate` tool initiates an Agent Team by creating a new team folder unde
content: The `TeamCreate` tool initiates an Agent Team by creating a new team folder under `.claude/teams/`, establishing the team's scaffolding before any agents are assigned. It requires a `team_name`, `description`, and `agent_type` (e.g., "researcher", "test-runner").

payload.content: The `TaskCreate` tool is used to create new to-do items, with each task stored as a JSON file under `.claude/tasks/team-id`. It tracks Task ID, Description, Status (pending, in_progress, complete, deleted), Owner, and Dependencies (blocks, blocked_by). Tasks can be delegated by the team-lead or self-claimed by agent team members.

name: The `TaskCreate` tool is used to create new to-do items, with each task stored a
content: The `TaskCreate` tool is used to create new to-do items, with each task stored as a JSON file under `.claude/tasks/team-id`. It tracks Task ID, Description, Status (pending, in_progress, complete, deleted), Owner, and Dependencies (blocks, blocked_by). Tasks can be delegated by the team-lead or self-claimed by agent team members.

payload.content: The `Task` tool, which activates agents, has been upgraded for Agent Teams with new parameters `name` (for the spawned agent's identity) and `team_name` (to join a team), which differentiate it from simple sub-agent subprocesses.

name: The `Task` tool, which activates agents, has been upgraded for Agent Teams with
content: The `Task` tool, which activates agents, has been upgraded for Agent Teams with new parameters `name` (for the spawned agent's identity) and `team_name` (to join a team), which differentiate it from simple sub-agent subprocesses.

payload.content: A 'teammate' agent is distinguished from a 'sub-agent' by the inclusion of 'name' and 'team_name' parameters when spawned, enabling it to join a team and communicate with other agents.

name: A 'teammate' agent is distinguished from a 'sub-agent' by the inclusion of 'name
content: A 'teammate' agent is distinguished from a 'sub-agent' by the inclusion of 'name' and 'team_name' parameters when spawned, enabling it to join a team and communicate with other agents.

payload.content: Agents are expected to use the `taskUpdate` tool to claim tasks, update their status (pending, in_progress, complete, deleted), modify task details (subject, description, activeForm, owner, metadata), and manage task dependencies (addBlocks, addBlockedBy).

name: Agents are expected to use the `taskUpdate` tool to claim tasks, update their st
content: Agents are expected to use the `taskUpdate` tool to claim tasks, update their status (pending, in_progress, complete, deleted), modify task details (subject, description, activeForm, owner, metadata), and manage task dependencies (addBlocks, addBlockedBy).

payload.content: The `sendMessage` tool facilitates communication within agent teams, supporting direct messages (agent to agent), broadcast messages (agent to all teammates), and specific message types like `shutdown_request`, `shutdown_response`, and `plan_approval_response`.

name: The `sendMessage` tool facilitates communication within agent teams, supporting
content: The `sendMessage` tool facilitates communication within agent teams, supporting direct messages (agent to agent), broadcast messages (agent to all teammates), and specific message types like `shutdown_request`, `shutdown_response`, and `plan_approval_response`.

payload.content: Messages sent via the `sendMessage` tool are stored in `.claude/teams/<team_id>/inbox/` for each agent and are injected as new user messages into the recipient agent's conversation history.

name: Messages sent via the `sendMessage` tool are stored in `.claude/teams/<team_id>/
content: Messages sent via the `sendMessage` tool are stored in `.claude/teams/<team_id>/inbox/` for each agent and are injected as new user messages into the recipient agent's conversation history.

payload.content: A team-lead agent can send a `shutdown_request` to a teammate agent, which then sends a `shutdown_response` to confirm, likely using a `postToolCall` hook to automatically terminate the agent session.

name: A team-lead agent can send a `shutdown_request` to a teammate agent, which then
content: A team-lead agent can send a `shutdown_request` to a teammate agent, which then sends a `shutdown_response` to confirm, likely using a `postToolCall` hook to automatically terminate the agent session.

payload.content: Agent Teams offer a more sophisticated communication channel and context sharing compared to sub-agents, opening up new possibilities for agentic tasks.

name: Agent Teams offer a more sophisticated communication channel and context sharing
content: Agent Teams offer a more sophisticated communication channel and context sharing compared to sub-agents, opening up new possibilities for agentic tasks.

payload.content: Agent teammates can be used to investigate different hypotheses and engage in a 'scientific debate' to disprove each other's theories, similar to how human scientists might collaborate to reach a consensus.

name: Agent teammates can be used to investigate different hypotheses and engage in a
content: Agent teammates can be used to investigate different hypotheses and engage in a 'scientific debate' to disprove each other's theories, similar to how human scientists might collaborate to reach a consensus.

payload.content: Using agent teams results in higher token consumption and slower speed compared to sub-agents, indicating a trade-off between sophistication and resource usage.

name: Using agent teams results in higher token consumption and slower speed compared
content: Using agent teams results in higher token consumption and slower speed compared to sub-agents, indicating a trade-off between sophistication and resource usage.

payload.content: Agent teams, combined with a 'ralph loop' (presumably a feedback or iterative process), could enable the structuring of extremely long-running agentic tasks.

name: Agent teams, combined with a 'ralph loop' (presumably a feedback or iterative pr
content: Agent teams, combined with a 'ralph loop' (presumably a feedback or iterative process), could enable the structuring of extremely long-running agentic tasks.
